edges.description: Fighters with this Edge deal instant punishment for an enemy’s mistakes. Once per turn (if not Shaken or Stunned), the character receives a Free Attack (page 101 SWADE) against one failed Fighting attack against him. The counterattack takes place immediately (before other hits against the hero on the same Action Card, if any).

edges.name: Improved Counterattack
edges.summary: As Counterattack, but against three foes per turn.
edges.description: As Counterattack but the hero gets a Free Attack against up to three failed attacks each turn.

edges.name: Dead Shot
edges.summary: Once per turn, double damage from Athletics (throwing) or  Shooting roll when dealt a Joker.
edges.description: When your Action Card is a Joker, double the total damage of your first successful Athletics (throwing) or Shooting roll this round.

edges.name: Dodge
edges.summary: -2 to be hit by ranged attacks
edges.description: The hero can anticipate attacks or move erratically under fire. Unless the victim of a surprise attack and taken completely unaware, Dodge subtracts 2 from all ranged attacks made against the character. Dodge does not stack with actual cover, however.

edges.name: Improved Dodge
edges.summary: +2 when Evading area effect attacks.
edges.description: The hero adds +2 when Evading area effect attacks. See Evasion on page 100 SWADE.

edges.name: Double Tap
edges.summary: +1 to hit and damage when firing no more than RoF 1 per action.
edges.description: Experienced firearms experts fire two shots in rapid succession without spoiling their aim. Double Tap can only be used with weapons that have a Rate of Fire of 1 and can fire two shots without needing to manually reload. It adds +1 to hit and damage at the cost of one extra bullet. This is per action, so a shooter can Double Tap more than once if she performs a Multi-Action. Double Tap cannot be combined with Rapid Fire. If used with a weapon capable of Three-Round Burst (see page 67 SWADE), it adds +2 to Shooting and damage instead of +1 and expends six bullets.

edges.name: Extraction
edges.summary: One adjacent foe doesn’t get a free attack when you withdraw  from close combat.
edges.description: When a character withdraws from melee, adjacent attackers get a free Fighting attack against him (see Withdrawing from Melee on page 109 SWADE). This is a very dangerous proposition for most, but not your wily champion. When moving away from adjacent foes, one of them (player’s choice), doesn’t get his free Fighting attack

edges.name: Improved Extraction
edges.summary: Three adjacent foes don’t get free attacks when you withdraw from combat.
edges.description: Up to three foes’ (player’s choice) don’t get attacks when your warrior moves out of melee with them.

edges.name: Feint
edges.summary: You may choose to make foe resist with Smarts instead of  Agility during a Fighting Test.
edges.description: When performing a Test (page 108 SWADE) with the Fighting skill, you can choose to make the foe resist with Smarts instead of Agility.

edges.name: First Strike
edges.summary: Free Fighting attack once per round when foe moves adjacent to you.
edges.description: Once per round, as long as he’s not Shaken or Stunned, the hero gets a free Fighting attack against a foe immediately after he moves into Reach. (See Free Attacks on page 101 SWADE).

edges.name: Improved First Strike
edges.summary: Free Fighting attack against up to three foes when they move adjacent.
edges.description: As First Strike, but the hero may attack up to three foes each turn.

edges.name: Free Runner
edges.summary: Ignore Difficult Ground and add +2 to Athletics in foot chases.
edges.description: Your character practices “parkour” or is just very skilled at running, jumping, swinging, scampering up walls, and over obstacles. As long as there are obstacles she can bound on, bounce off, or swing on, she moves at her full Pace on Difficult Ground penalties when on foot. She also adds +2 to her Athletics rolls when climbing and in foot Chases (see Chases & Vehicles page 113 SWADE).

edges.name: Frenzy
edges.summary: Roll a second Fighting die with one melee attack per turn.
edges.description: A character with Frenzy rolls a second Fighting die with any one of his Fighting attacks for the turn. The extra die may be allocated to the same or different targets as he sees fit. Resolve each separately.

edges.name: Improved Frenzy
edges.summary: Roll a second Fighting die with up to two melee attacks per turn.
edges.description: The fighter rolls an extra Fighting die with up to two Fighting attacks in the same turn.

edges.name: Giant Killer
edges.summary: +1d6 damage vs. creatures three Sizes larger or more.
edges.description: The bigger they are, the harder they are to kill. At least for most. Your hero knows how to find the weak points in the most massive of foes. He adds +1d6 damage when attacking creatures who are three or more Sizes larger than himself (see Size, page 178 SWADE). A human (Size 0) gets the bonus against a creature of Size 3.

edges.name: Hard to Kill
edges.summary: Ignore Wound penalties when making Vigor rolls to avoid Bleeding Out.
edges.description: This adventurer has more lives than a herd of cats. He may ignore his Wound penalties when making Vigor rolls to avoid Bleeding Out (see page 95 SWADE).

edges.name: Harder to Kill
edges.summary: Roll a die if the character perishes. Even if he’s Incapacitated, he survives somehow.
edges.description: Your hero is tougher to kill than Rasputin. If he is ever “killed,” roll a die. On an odd result, he’s dead as usual. On an even roll, he’s Incapacitated but somehow escapes death. He may be captured, stripped of all his belongings, or mistakenly left for dead, but he somehow survives

edges.name: Improvisational Fighter
edges.summary: Ignore penalties to attack and Parry when using Improvised weapons.
edges.description: Heroes often find themselves fighting with pieces of equipment or furnishings not designed for combat. A brawler with this Edge has a knack for using such improvised weapons. He ignores the usual –2 penalty when wielding them. See page 102 SWADE for details on Improvised Weapons.

edges.name: Iron Jaw
edges.summary: +2 to Soak and Vigor rolls to avoid Knockout Blows.
edges.description: The hero can shrug off even extreme blows. He adds +2 to Soak rolls and Vigor rolls to avoid Knockout Blows (see page 100 SWADE)

edges.name: Killer Instinct
edges.summary: Free reoll on opposed tests you initiate
edges.description: This hero hates losing. He gets a free reroll in any opposed Test he initiates.

edges.name: Level Headed
edges.summary: Draw an additional Action Card each round and choose which one to use.
edges.description: Fighters who can keep their cool when everyone else is running for cover make deadly combatants. A hero with this Edge draws an additional Action Card in combat and chooses which to use.

edges.name: Improved Level Headed
edges.summary: Draw three Action Cards each round and choose which one to use.
edges.description: As Level Headed but the hero draws two additional cards and chooses which to keep.

edges.name: Marksman
edges.summary: Ignore up to 2 points of Athletics (throwing) or Shooting penalties  when not moving and firing no more than RoF 1 per action.
edges.description: The hero is a natural with ranged weapons. If she doesn’t move in a turn and fires no more than a Rate of Fire of 1 per action, she may ignore up to 2 points of Athletics (throwing) or Shooting penalties from Called Shots, Cover, Range, Scale, or Speed. This stacks with the Aim maneuver and applies to each Shooting or throwing action that turn.

edges.name: Martial Artist
edges.summary: Unarmed Fighting +1, ignore Unarmed Defender rule, add d4  damage die to unarmed Fighting attacks (or increase die a step  if you already have it).
edges.description: The fighter has trained in basic martial arts. Her fists and feet are weapons (see Natural Weapons, page 104 SWADE) so she’s always considered armed. She adds +1 when striking with them and causes Strength+d4 damage. If she already has a Strength damage die from the Claws racial ability (page 18 SWADE) or the Brawler Edge, increase the damage a die type. Martial Artist does not add to damage from other Natural Weapons such as fangs or horns.

edges.name: Martial Warrior
edges.summary: Unarmed Fighting +2, increase damage die type a step.
edges.description: Increase the warrior’s Fighting bonus to +2 and her damage die an additional step.

edges.name: Mighty Blow
edges.summary: Once per turn, double Fighting damage when dealt a Joker.
edges.description: If your Action Card is a Joker, double the damage of your first successful Fighting attack this round.

edges.name: Nerves of Steel
edges.summary: Ignore one level of Wound penalties.
edges.description: Your hero has learned to fight on through the most intense pain. He may ignore 1 point of Wound penalties.

edges.name: Improved Nerves of Steel
edges.summary: Ignore up to two levels of Wound penalties.
edges.description: The hero ignores two points of Wound penalties.

edges.name: No Mercy
edges.summary: +2 damage when spending a Benny to reroll damage.
edges.description: When this killer spends a Benny to reroll damage, he adds +2 to his final total.

edges.name: Rapid Fire
edges.summary: Increase RoF by 1 for one Shooting attack per turn.
edges.description: The shooter is practiced at taking quick and accurate shots. As long as she’s armed with a fast-firing ranged weapon of some sort (such as a revolver or semi-automatic) and has enough ammunition to do so, she may increase her weapon’s Rate of Fire by 1 for any one of her Shooting attacks that turn.

edges.name: Improved Rapid Fire
edges.summary: Increase RoF by 1 for up to two Shooting attacks per turn.
edges.description: The shooter may now increase her weapon’s Rate of Fire by 1 twice in the same turn (via a Multi-Action).

edges.name: Rock and Roll!
edges.summary: Ignore the Recoil penalty when firing weapons with a RoF of 2 or more.
edges.description: Experienced shooters learn to compensate for the recoil of fully automatic weapons. If a character with this Edge doesn’t move on his turn, he ignores the Recoil penalty when firing at a Rate of Fire of 2 or higher. (See Recoil, page 105 SWADE).

edges.name: Steady Hands
edges.summary: Ignore Unstable Platform penalty; reduce running penalty to –1.
edges.description: Firing from the back of a horse or moving vehicle is tricky business, but your adventurer has figured it out. She ignores the Unstable Platform penalty (see page 109 SWADE). This also helps when running, reducing the usual penalty from −2 to −1 (see Movement, page 92).

edges.name: Sweep
edges.summary: Fighting roll at –2 to hit all targets in weapon’s Reach, no more  than once per turn.
edges.description:
Sweep allows a character to make a single Fighting attack and apply it against all targets in his Reach at a −2 penalty (friends and foes alike). Resolve damage separately for each enemy that’s hit. 

A fighter may only perform a Sweep once per turn. It may not be combined with Frenzy

edges.name: Improved Sweep
edges.summary: As Sweep, but ignore the –2 penalty.
edges.description: As Sweep, but the whirlwind of death may ignore the −2 penalty.

edges.name: Trademark Weapon
edges.summary: +1 to Athletics (throwing), Fighting, or Shooting total with a  specific weapon; +1 Parry while weapon is readied.
edges.description:
The hero knows one unique weapon (Excalibur, Old Betsy, Sting) like the back of his hand. When using it, he adds +1 to his Athletics (throwing), Fighting, or Shooting rolls, and +1 to Parry when readied (even if it’s a ranged weapon). 

A fighter can take this Edge multiple times, applying it to a different weapon each time. If a Trademark Weapon is lost, he can replace it but the benefits don’t kick in for a few days (however long the GM feels is dramatically appropriate).

edges.name: Improved Trademark Weapon
edges.summary: The bonus increases to +2.
edges.description: As Trademark Weapon, but the bonuses when using the weapon increase to +2.

edges.name: Two-Fisted
edges.summary: When making a Fighting attack, make one extra Fighting roll  with second weapon at no Multi-Action penalty.
edges.description: If a character makes a Fighting attack with one action and another from a different hand in a later action, the second attack doesn’t inflict a Multi-Action penalty. The Off-Hand penalty still applies unless he’s Ambidextrous, however (page 104 SWADE). If the character has Two-Gun Kid, the second action may also be a ranged attack.

edges.name: Two-Gun Kid
edges.summary: Wielding two ranged weapons, make one extra Shooting roll  with second weapon at no Multi-Action penalty.
edges.description:
Two-Gun Kid works just like Two-Fisted, but with ranged weapons, allowing her to fire or throw a weapon in each hand as two different actions but without triggering a Multi-Action penalty. 

If the character has Two-Fisted, the second action may also be a melee attack.

edges.name: Command
edges.summary: Extras in Command Range get +1 to Spirit rolls.
edges.description: Command is the basic ability to give clear instructions and support to allies in the thick of battle (5'' / 10 yards). Extras in Command Range add +1 to their Spirit rolls when attempting to recover from being Shaken.

edges.name: Command Presence
edges.summary: Increase Command Range to 10'' / 20 yards.
edges.description: A booming voice, effective commands, natural charisma, or simple training results in a much more effective combat element. A hero with this Edge has a Command Range of 10″ (20 yards).

edges.name: Fervor
edges.summary: Extras get +1 to Fighting damage rolls.
edges.description:
A simple phrase uttered by a great leader can sometimes have momentous results. A commander with this ability can inspire his troops to bloody fervor by yelling a motto, slogan, or other inspirational words. 

Extras in range add +1 to their Fighting damage rolls.

edges.name: Hold the Line
edges.summary: Extras get +1 Toughness
edges.description: Hold the Line strengthens the will of any Extras under the hero’s command, adding +1 to their Toughness.

edges.name: Inspire
edges.summary: Once per turn, the hero may roll his Battle skill to Support one  type of Trait roll, and apply it to everyone in Command Range
edges.description:
Exceptional leaders inspire those around them to great feats of valor and determination. Once per turn, the hero may roll his Battle skill to Support one type of Trait roll, and apply it to all allied Extras in Command Range. A leader could Support all Shooting attacks in range, for example, or all Spirit rolls to recover from being Shaken. 

Inspire is an action and requires some sort of communication with those it affects

edges.name: Natural Leader
edges.summary: Leadership Edges that apply to Extras now apply to Wild  Cards as well.
edges.description:
This leader has proven herself time and time again, gaining the respect of all those who fight by her side. 

Any Leadership Edge that says it applies only to Extras now applies to Wild Cards as well.

edges.name: Tactician
edges.summary: Give an Action card to Extras
edges.description:
The commander has a natural grasp of small unit tactics and can take advantage of rapidly changing situations. 

A Tactician is dealt an extra Action Card each round of combat or a chase—kept separate from his own cards. At the start of the round, he may discard it or give it to any one allied Extra in Command Range. The player or GM controlling the receiving character can decide whether to accept and replace her current Action Card, or discard it

edges.name: Master Tactician
edges.summary: Distribute two extra action cards to Extras.
edges.description: The Tactician now gets a total of two extra Action Cards to distribute each round

edges.name: Artificer
edges.requirements: Arcane background (any, Weird scientists have it automatically)
edges.description: Those who tangle with supernatural forces sometimes find ways to imbue powers into items. They may turn an ordinary blade into a magic sword, brew a potion that can heal an ally’s Wounds, or even bless a holy relic with divine grace. Artificers can create wondrous items and devices using the Arcane Devices system found on page 152 SWADE.

edges.name: Gadgeteer
edges.requirements: Arcane background (weird science), Weird Science d6+

edges.name: Power Surge
edges.requirements: Arcane background (any), arcane skill d8+, Wild Card

edges.name: Assassin
edges.requirements: Agility d8+, Fighting d6+, Stealth d8+

edges.name: McGyver
